content.statement: aku-005-primes-biology-cicadas is a fundamental concept in Science Math Number-Theory Primes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aku-005-primes-biology-cicadas helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aku-005-primes-biology-cicadas include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aku-005-primes-biology-cicadas.

definitions_glossary.periodical_cicadas: Cicada species with synchronized emergence on prime-numbered year cycles
definitions_glossary.magicicada: Genus of periodical cicadas native to eastern North America
definitions_glossary.brood: Geographically isolated population emerging the same year
definitions_glossary.emergence: Mass synchronized surfacing of adult cicadas after underground development
definitions_glossary.predator_satiation: Strategy where overwhelming numbers ensure some individuals survive
definitions_glossary.lcm: Least common multiple - smallest number divisible by two or more numbers

evidence: Computer simulations show prime periods maximize survival
Mathematical analysis of lcm for various period combinations
Fossil evidence suggests periodic cicadas existed 1.8 million years ago
No stable non-prime period species observed

broods.note: 15 distinct broods across North America, numbered I-XV (some extinct)
broods.geographic_distribution: Eastern United States, from Georgia to Connecticut to Wisconsin

prefLabel.@value: Prime Numbers in Cicada Life Cycles

altLabel.@value: Periodical Cicadas and Prime Number Evolution

definition.@value: Biological application of prime numbers where periodical cicadas have evolved 13 or 17-year life cycles as an evolutionary strategy to minimize predator encounters

prerequisites.title: Prime Numbers
prerequisites.reason: Cicada cycles use prime number periods

prerequisites.title: Natural Selection
prerequisites.reason: Prime cycles evolved through natural selection

enables.title: Population Dynamics Models
enables.reason: Cicada emergence models inform population biology

enables.title: Mathematical Ecology
enables.reason: Example of mathematics in ecological systems

related.relationship: Prime cycles are coprime to most predator cycles
Synchronized emergence is a timing phenomenon

skos:related.skos:note: Similar synchronized periodic phenomenon in plants
Another domain where periodic phenomena occur

learning_objectives: Understand the connection between primes and cicada life cycles
Explain the evolutionary advantage of prime-numbered periods
common_errors: Believing all cicadas have prime cycles (only Magicicada)
Not understanding the role of natural selection
Assuming prime cycles guarantee survival (just increases probability)
teaching_tips: Start with hands-on example: mark years when 12-cycle vs 13-cycle meets 3-cycle predator
Use timeline visualization showing encounter frequencies
Discuss other examples of math in nature (Fibonacci in flowers, hexagons in honeycombs)
Show videos/images of massive cicada emergences
Emphasize that evolution can 'discover' mathematical properties
